intro: Atalanthus nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky plains. Its slender, leafless stems rise from the ground, bearing clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The species is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
